<!-- WARNING: this file was generated by Pulumi Docs Generator. -->
<!-- Do not edit by hand unless you're certain you know what you are doing! -->

Describes an endpoint authorization for authorizing Redshift-managed VPC endpoint access to a cluster across AWS accounts.




## Create a EndpointAuthorization Resource {#create}

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The target AWS account ID to grant or revoke access for.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="clusteridentifier_csharp">
<a href="#clusteridentifier_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Cluster<wbr>Identifier</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The cluster identifier.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="force_csharp">
<a href="#force_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Force</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}} Indicates whether to force the revoke action. If true, the Redshift-managed VPC endpoints associated with the endpoint authorization are also deleted.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="vpcids_csharp">
<a href="#vpcids_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Vpc<wbr>Ids</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The virtual private cloud (VPC) identifiers to grant or revoke access to.{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
